revised_title: Evolutionary Systematics of Bivalve Molluscs: Selection, Ecology, and Evolutionary Adjustment
tldr: This article explores the evolutionary systematics of bivalve molluscs, focusing on selection, ecology, and evolutionary adjustments within their populations. The authors discuss genetic polymorphism, population structure, and the balance between migration and selection in the evolution of bivalve molluscs. They also examine the role of environmental gradients, dispersal modes, and habitat exploitation in shaping genetic differentiation and variation.
